definition: lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: Sichuan's is delicately carved and is famous for its rubbing patterns.
sentences.chinese: 四川的精雕细刻，是著名的摩擦模式。

sentences.english: This essay is a most conscientious piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这篇论文是精雕细刻的工作。

sentences.english: These buildings are for two layers, with well-crafted pattern of the monolith.
sentences.chinese: 这些建筑大多为两层，配有精雕细刻图案的石门。

sentences.english: Oxford, in those days, was still a city of aquatint.
sentences.chinese: 牛津，那时还是一座精雕细刻的城市。

sentences.english: We from beginning to end importunate works the principle is " of " work at sth with special care.
sentences.chinese: 我们始终坚持的一个工作原则是“精雕细刻”。

sentences.english: The key still lies in fine craftsmanship.
sentences.chinese: 那么关键还是靠精雕细刻。

sentences.english: These wooden carvings are very delicate and refined.
sentences.chinese: 这些木雕真可以说是精雕细刻。

definition: original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to sculpt/to carve (jade)/ornate artwork/overly elaborate prose
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
